alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 19 at 4:08AM ChST until December 21 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...East facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...Through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A northwest swell, generated by strong to gale-force winds behind a cold front located south of Japan, is approaching the Marianas. This will increase surf along north and west facing reefs around Tuesday. This could expand the high risk of rip currents to north facing reefs and generate hazardous surf along north facing reefs as well.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
